sections.content: The property acquired by Karadi Rama Rao by virtue of Partition Deed No. 7971 of 2023, dated 16/Dec/2023, being Item No.01, of the Schedule-'B', measuring an extent of 278.3 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 6-688, Assessment no. 688, comprised in Survey No. 260/6, Sub-Division Survey No. 260/9, classified by Government, situated in Thurputallu Revenue Village & Pedamainavanilanka Grama Panchayati, Narasapuram Mandal, within the District of West Godavari, registered at sub-registrar office Narsapur, is bounded as follows: North by: Tirumani Narasimha Swamy Site South by: A. Schedule Property East by: Tirumani Peddi Raju Etc Site West by: Chintha Bogeswara Rao Etc Site Note: It is to be noted that our legal verification is limited towards the property offered as security for the purpose of loan, i.e., Item No. 01, of the Schedule- 'B' property of the Partition Deed.

As per Registered Documents: 1. The property comprised in Survey Nos. 260/6, Sub-Division Survey No. 260/9, classified by Government, bearing house no. 6-688, Assessment No. 688, situated in Thurputallu, measuring about 278.3 Sq.Yds., and other extent was originally owned by Karadi Satyanarayana, who acquired the property through Sale Deed, Vide Document No. 1948 of 2011. [Ref.EC & Deed] 2. Thereupon, the said Karadi Satyanarayana died intestate on 13-Mar-2015, leaving behind 1. Karadi Narasimha Swamy and 2. Karadi Rama Rao, as his family members. NoteIt is noted that the Death Certificate and FMC of Karadi Satyanarayana were not provided for our perusal; hence, we are unable to ascertain his legal heirs or verify whether there are any other legal heirs apart from those mentioned in the Deed. Upon enquiry, the F.I. stated that the Property Tax Receipt stands in the name of the present owner, Therefore it is advisable for F.I. to obtain Property Tax Receipt in the name of current owner. 3. The aforementioned 1. Karadi Narasimha Swamy and 2. Karadi Rama Rao executed a Partition Deed on 16/Dec/2023, registered as document No. 7971 of 2023, before the SRO Narsapur amongst them Karadi Rama Rao acquired right over Schedule 'B' property of partition deed measuring 278.3 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 6-688, Assessment no. 688, comprised in Survey Nos. 260/6, Sub-Division Survey No. 260/9, classified by Government, situated in Thurputallu Village. (B) Additional Documents Supporting the Title : The Property Demand Notice vide No. 304601, imprinted by the Pedamainavanilanka Panchayath Secretary discloses that Karadi Satyanarayana, was demanded to clear the tax for the period 2026, towards the property bearing house number 6-688, Assessment no. 688. Note: The attached Property tax demand notice stands in the name of Karadi Satyanarayana, who deceased on 13-Mar-2015, But the property tax still stands in the name of deceased Karadi Satyanarayana. It is therefore advisable for the F.I. to verify the same. Further, As per demand notice if the property tax due is not paid within 15 days from the date of the demand notice, the property will be confiscated. Hence, it is, advisable to verify that the tax is paid up-to-date towards the schedule property.

The property tax receipt attached discloses that Karadi Satyanarayana is the taxpayer, hence, it is presumed that the mutation proceedings were not concluded in the name of the current owner Karadi Rama Rao.

sections.content: We have reviewed the documents provided to us as per the F.I policy and have concluded that the Karadi Rama Rao, possesses a clear, valid, and marketable title to the property measuring  extent 278.3 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 6-688, Assessment no. 688, comprised in Survey Nos. 260/6, Sub-Division Survey No. 260/9, classified by Government, situated in Thurputallu Revenue Village & Pedamainavanilanka Grama Panchayati, Narasapuram Mandal, within the District of West Godavari, registered at sub-registrar office Narsapur.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
